text: (upbeat music)
- Hi, my name is Ambud Sharma.

I'm a tech lead of data
engineering at Pinterest.
I started my career

in tech early days and
started with research,
especially in distributor systems
and kept digging further and further
until I found how to actually

build these distributor
systems from scratch.

And that led me to more
and more opportunities

of running systems at
larger and larger scale.
And I finally landed a job at Pinterest.

I realized that data was
going to continue growing
and it was going to be the next big thing.

The most interesting
part is really working
at the scale at which we do.

It's about challenging
ourselves to solve problems
that have not been solved before
and coming up with unique solutions

that are efficient, scalable,
and can benefit the planet.

And the most enabling product
for us has been Amazon S3.
It's been foundational to our platform
and specifically for me,

being able to build a popup
system on top of Amazon S3

with a called MemQueue has
been a game changer for us.
The thing I'm most proud
about is our product really helps reach
out to so many users and inspires them.
Pinterest is a home for inspiration.
I love the culture that we have a value
called be an owner.
And everybody basically puts that first
and putting Pinners first

basically figuring out
what needs to be done
and collaborate and come together
when we have issues or problems.
The advice I'd like to give people

is to really dig in
deep into the technology

and concepts and understand
the takeaway points.

You can actually learn
the basic principles
and you really become good at them.
You can apply them at so many places,
distributor systems
boil down to some basic concepts.
Come build with me.
